modules.description: This module defines character mappings for various languages that replace non-URL-safe characters during slug generation. It provides specific lists like `base`, `de`, `es`, and others, each containing tuples of characters to substitute. These mappings are used directly to transform strings into URL-friendly slugs by replacing special characters according to the specified rules.

Handles character replacement and normalization for URL slugs using customizable charmaps. Works with UTF-8 strings and structured replacement rules in lists of string pairs. Used to generate language-specific or custom slugs by replacing non-URL-safe characters according to defined mappings.

This library transforms strings into URL-safe slugs by normalizing UTF-8 input, replacing non-alphanumeric characters using customizable mappings, and substituting whitespace with a specified separator. It supports operations like lowercasing, custom separator selection, and language-specific character replacement through predefined mappings such as `base`, `de`, and `es`. Child modules provide structured charmaps and replacement logic, enabling users to generate localized slugs or define custom substitution rules for specific use cases like web routing or content indexing. Direct API functions allow easy integration with standard OCaml strings while maintaining flexibility for advanced normalization strategies.
